summary:
Objectives:
To contribute to civic education, community- and organizational cohesion and collaboration through the application of narrative approaches and storytelling methods.
For that I employ my knowledge of fine arts, communication, socio-ecology, storytelling, diverse narrative approaches and my experience as a teacher and trainer.
My needs are simple: to obtain – practically and research -  the best possible knowledge and tools to achieve my objectives

I have more than 40 years experience in communication as a creative director and strategist at international agencies. My interest in what makes people tick led to a BSc in psychology (and socio-ecology of behavior). I can distinguish clearly the difference between a good and a bad story. 
Next to my work in organizations and European (Erasmus+) education projects I am a lecturer at the SAE Media Institute Amsterdam (Story Development) and a guest lecturer (Storytelling in organizations) at the Rotterdam School of Management (2016 - 2018, Erasmus University, Rotterdam).

In recent years I have developed (adult) educational curricula, trainings and workshops within the Erasmus+ program of the European Lifelong Learning program. The training 'Strengthening the Community by Storytelling' has won an international European award (Learn for Life, 2014). Recent Erasmus+ projects where I was a partner in: Artful Leader, Guerrilla Literacy Learners (GuLL), Raising Strong and Resilient Communities, StoryTeller and Common Ground Common Future (2019-2021), and INGAME (2019-).

For current projects see below.

Visit my website: http://www.storybag.nl 

Languages: fluent in Dutch, English and German (all spoken and written), some French 

Specialized in: 
Narrative approaches 
Applied storytelling (i.e. education)
Narrative coaching
Story collecting
Story development (teams, organizations)
Workshops
Courses / Trainings
Copywriting

treasury_media.title: International Award for Storybag
treasury_media.description: 13 September 2013, Nijmegen, The Netherlands, Learning Festival (a wordlwide initiative by UNESCO. Storybag was presented with the Encouragement Award for innovation in ‘adult education with an international dimension' for the project ’Strengthening the community by storytelling’. The festival was organised by Learn for Life, European Platform and supported by the European Commission / Culture and Education. The award was presented by Euro-parlamentarian Wim van de Camp.

awards.title: International Award Learn for Life / European Platform for Grundtvig Project
awards.description: Jury report: "...The jury is impressed with this project because it is transferable and because it is applicable to each age category and (cultural) background. This is a small project, of which the impact for the participants is very large. The methods used are good to employ in all kinds of organizations and in the adult education."

projects.title: Think Global Act Local - Narrative approaches in Diversity & Inclusion Management
projects.description: This is an Erasmus+ project with partners from Italy, Ireland, Czechoslovakia, Slovenia, Bulgaria, Cyprus and the Netherlands. The project is seeking to support cultural change within companies by using the power of storytelling to inspire managers and employees to change, to share values, and to transfer not just knowledge, but experience and wisdom.

contributors.headline: Owner at Storybag

projects.title: STEM+A
projects.description: In this Erasmus+ project we aim to develop a new methodology by integrating STEM subjects with storytelling (art) for the development of 21st century "4 C's" skills (critical thinking, communication, collaboration and creative thinking skills of students aged 14-18). The specific aims of the project are to encourage STEM + A (Storytelling) activities, to prepare guidelines for STEM + A (Storytelling) and to share good practices.

contributors.headline: Owner at Storybag

projects.title: VOICES - Empowering women for equal participation and driving change
projects.description: VOICES is a European (Erasmus+) project that aims to help bridging the gender divide and foster women's participation in society, by providing women and professionals working with them with a set of gender-responsive educational resources, specifically designed to promote gender equality and equal participation in society.

contributors.headline: Owner at Storybag

projects.title: INGAME
projects.description: A 3-year Erasmus project (KA3), serious gaming to initiate civic engagement and participation in different action fields (gender, education, social inclusion, urban life, environment/clikmate, and global issues (i.e. migration)

contributors.headline: Owner at Storybag

projects.title: Expert Meeting of Story Practitioners
projects.description:
Expert Meeting - The power of story/de kracht van een verhaal 
Het woord 'Storytelling' duikt op in: journalistiek, kunst, marketing, organisatieverandering, communicatie, gaming etc. Verhalen zijn krachtig en iedereen vertelt ze. Ook mensen die zich geen verhalenverteller noemen.
Laatst was er op deze lijst nog een korte discussie over het woord storytelling: het lijkt weleens alsof het een term is die vooral door anderen dan vertellers gebruikt wordt om het verhalen vertellen nieuw elan te geven. Hoe erg is dat, kan je je vervolgens afvragen. Deze expertmeeting is bedoeld om met elkaar in gesprek te gaan: vertellers met marketeers, storytellers, journalisten  en anderen. Iedereen die 'de kracht van verhalen' tot zijn vak rekent, die daarover kan vertellen en die nieuwsgierig is naar ervaring van anderen is welkom. Wat is storytelling en hoe werken verhalen in die verschillende werelden?  Hoe zetten de verschillende werelden de ‘power of story’ in? Wat kunnen we van elkaar leren? Zijn het aparte werelden, of hebben we het uiteindelijk toch allemaal over hetzelfde?
De organisatie/redactie is dit jaar in handen van: Arjen Barel (Storytelling Festival/Storytelling Centre) Peter Fruhmann (digital storytelling), Annet Scheringa (organizational storytelling) en Nancy Wiltink (verhalenverteller), Eva Snijders (corporate storytelling) en Gerard Smit (journalistiek) zijn aanwezig als experts storytelling op hun vakgebied.

projects.title: Artful Leadership | developing the new generation of servant leaders through arts
projects.description:
The main goal of the project is to create an innovative digital learning resources about Servant Leadership, supported by arts-based learning methods and deployed through different methods and techniques (e.g. digital storytelling, visual art, design thinking, etc.).

These digital learning resources can be easily implemented in formal and non-formal education settings.

projects.title: GuLL - Guerilla Literacy Learners
projects.description:
There is currently a global learning crisis, where 250 million of the 650 million primary school children worldwide are not taught basic literacy skills. In Western Europe, however, 96% reach grade 5 level reading skills. 
Europe is confronted with a very large group of students who are unable to acquire basic literacy. Students continue to fail tests and many quit studying although they could have become very good professionals in different fields. As a consequence, teachers and researchers are looking for new ways of teaching basic literacy skills.
Furthermore, present day society allows citizens to move freely between different countries. This opportunity has created a new kind of illiteracy where highly qualified and literate people in their native language become NEET people (not in employment, education or training) in their new countries.
Finally, literacy used to be taught from functional, to social and critical literacy, the hypothesis being that you need the operational literacy to be able to participate in society. Modern day society, however, sees citizens who are socially and critically literate without being operationally literate. 
Guerilla Literacy Learners (GuLL) is a student-centered approach which helps language learners improve their language acquisition skills. GuLL switches from how learners should learn to how they actually learn thus embracing the European recommendation that if students fail to learn, teachers might want to teach in a different way. GuLL asks learners to reflect upon the unorthodox links (Guerilla patterns) they make and then remediate it.

contributors.headline: Owner at Storybag

projects.title: SINBAD, a journey to promote key competences in early childhood education through storytelling
projects.description: The Sinbad project (Erasmus+) aims at promoting storytelling and the use of storytelling techniques in pre-school and primary school education, in order to enhance the key competences acquired by children. The project activities therefore support pre-school and primary school teachers in learning or further developing oral storytelling, gives advice on how to actively involve children and impart methods for a targeted competence development.

projects.title: Erasmus+ KA2: Raising Strong and Resilient Communities
projects.description:
Background and current setting:
Economic and social times are changing, globally and in Europe. Communities are in transition, and not only through migration. Citizens are obliged to become more self-sufficient. These are changes and challenges not easily accepted and dealt with. 
Successful initiatives depend on factors such as trust, sharing emotions, recognising and accepting differences. If cohesion and progress are the objectives, then storytelling delivers the tools and also creates engagement and compassion. Stories of shared values, shared plans and more equality provide the best examples for all that. The most successful story expressing this is democracy.

The project:
With the project ‘Raising Strong and resilient Communities’ the consortium wants to develop a set of educational tools that can be used in adult education (with a focus on non-formal adult education) focussing on active citizenship and participation. These tools are based on existing and the further expansion of developed approaches, theories and methods of storytelling. 
These tools are a teacher/ trainer manual, structured courses for adult educators, and a collection of videos/ audio recordings to showcase best practices and function as instruction videos.
The tools will be developed around the development of competences of cooperation and communication in differing communities, between various ‘divides’, such as intergenerational, intercultural, etc in order for learners to actively engage in local community work.

projects.title: Erasmus+ KA2: Sinbad - a journey to promote key competences in early childhood education through storytelling
projects.description:
The Sinbad project aims at promoting storytelling and the use of storytelling techniques in pre-school and primary school education in order to enhance the key competences acquisition by children.
Research has proven impressively that early childhood education is the most important time to initiate a healthy development and prevent effectively development problems.  The continuous education and training of staff  therefore is a fundamental issue for the quality of early childhood education provision. Creative approaches that can involve all children-independent from their social or ethnic background are needed. 

Telling stories offers a powerful methodology to support the development of children. It supports the listening and reading comprehension and is a natural opportunity for children to grow as language users. It besides provides a possibility for children to interact with the cultural context of fairytales, folktales and other stories, it strengthens the children's ability to concentrate and fosters creativity as well as critical thinking by stimulating discussion and debate.

projects.title: Orality, Oracy and Literacy - Facilitating Adult Literacy with Storytelling
projects.description: The aim of this 6-day storytelling workshop (funded by the Grundtvig Programme) is to bring together motivated educators with an interest in (or already experienced in) storytelling as a tool for literacy education. The workshop aims at offering inspiring insights, tools and skills and  expects the (re)discovery of the ‘art of storytelling’ in teaching, but also wants to let the participants exchange their specific (national and local) knowledge and experiences in the field of adult literacy education.

projects.title: ‘Oral Skills, Oracy and Literacy’ - Facilitating Adult Literacy with Storytelling
projects.description: A workshop-week with 22 enthusiastic European participants within the Grundtvig Programme of the European Commission, filled with theory (literacy and story grammar) and practical exercises to inspire the facilitation of adult literacy with storytelling and narrative techniques.
